articles.headline: Alcan Rejects a Hostile Bid From Alcoa
articles.snippet: The Canadian aluminum producer Alcan rejected a $27.4 billion hostile bid from a rival, Alcoa, calling the offer inadequate.
articles.abstract: The Canadian aluminum producer Alcan rejected a $27.4 billion hostile bid from a rival, Alcoa, calling the offer inadequate.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA, May 22  The Canadian aluminum producer Alcan rejected a $27.4 billion hostile bid from a rival, Alcoa, on Tuesday, calling the offer inadequate. Alcan said that it was in talks with other companies and added that it was considering the possibility of turning the tables with a counterbid for Alcoa.

articles.headline: Home Depot to Investors: Mea Culpa
articles.snippet: The chief for the home improvement chain will try to make up for past mistakes by laying out his vision for the future at its annual meeting Wednesday.
articles.abstract: The chief for the home improvement chain will try to make up for past mistakes by laying out his vision for the future at its annual meeting Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was, as even Home Depot executives will concede, a 37-minute fiasco.

articles.headline: 3 Global Financial Institutions’ Roles Questioned
articles.snippet: The World Bank, the I.M.F. and the W.T.O. are now facing questions about their relevance in a global economy.
articles.abstract: The World Bank, the I.M.F. and the W.T.O. are now facing questions about their relevance in a global economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 22  The crisis has ended over Paul D. Wolfowitz, the president of the World Bank who resigned last week. But the bank’s identity crisis has just begun.

articles.headline: As Comrades Search, Fatal Bomb Wreaks Havoc
articles.snippet: American soldiers lost one of their own on Saturday in an effort to follow a creed: no soldier left behind.
articles.abstract: American soldiers lost one of their own on Saturday in an effort to follow a creed: no soldier left behind.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAHMUDIYA, Iraq, May 22 — The ground exploded under an ashen sky at dawn. Dust, dirt, blood and military equipment filled the air, clearing after several seconds to reveal a frenzied scene of horror.

articles.headline: For Drug Makers, a Downside to Full Disclosure
articles.snippet: Web data that showed a risk for a diabetes drug is likely to spur more efforts to publicly disclose drug study results.
articles.abstract: Web data that showed a risk for a diabetes drug is likely to spur more efforts to publicly disclose drug study results.

articles.headline: Debate Raging, Mexico Adds to Consulates in U.S.
articles.snippet: Mexico’s 47 consulates in the U.S. are acting as influential free agents in a broken immigration system.
articles.abstract: Mexico’s 47 consulates in the U.S. are acting as influential free agents in a broken immigration system.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the surface, there was nothing extraordinary about a certain government office in Little Rock, Ark., the other day as paperwork was signed, names were called, fees were paid, waits were endured and computer keyboards went tap, tap, tap.

articles.headline: Worth a Lot, but Are Hedge Funds Worth It?
articles.snippet: The hedge fund stars may gleam, but the average fund did worse last year, after fees, than the S.& P.
articles.abstract: The hedge fund stars may gleam, but the average fund did worse last year, after fees, than the S.& P.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Institutional Investor’s Alpha magazine released its annual list of the highest paid hedge fund managers last month, it allowed the rest of us to play an entertaining little parlor game: what could you buy if you made as much money as those guys?
